review_text: People
All aspects of stay met our expectations
Could use some updates but overall property was clean with great customer service.
Great stay, check in to check out!
Staff was amazing.

It is a normal business style hotel.  Friendly staff.  If you drive, expect to pay for parking, and the valet staff are possibly the friendliest I've ever seen.  They will take care of you and your car.

The restaurant food was mediocre. The wine prices were outrageous for the brands.  And the cr√®me br√ªl√©e was the worst i e ever experienced.  The chef needs to be taught how to make it.  I was told by the server that this is the way the chef likes to make it and then mentioned that many people don't like it.  She waived the charge.
The staff is exceptionally friendly and accommodating.  An additional bonus is the restaurant, it was actually the best food we had while in Denver! Hats off to the new Chef!
Beautiful hotel. Great staff
Nice
I love it !!
I love the lobby!  Tyler (?) at the front desk was very friendly and helpful!
Very welcoming and easy to get to from airport on train
Our stay here was great!! Easily accessible to lots of stuff..very clean rooms, bar was nice, live music üé∂ was great.

This is a lovely hotel.  The lobby and features of the old bank building and it's original artwork are very unique.  This large space presents as warm and welcoming and the staff further adds to that feeling.  
The room was immaculate, beds were comfortable, no outside, downtown noise penetrated.
Highly recommend
Very pretty lobby, nice staff :)
While most of downtown is still under construction, it‚Äôs still easy to get around. There are plenty of restaurants and shops around the area. Range in the hotel and the teller bar, amazing!

Let me start by saying the staff here is top notch. Everyone from the front desk concierge to the bartender were so friendly and welcoming. 

The main complaints are small, but noteworthy- 
The tv remote in our room barely worked, which was fine, we made it work. At 10:45AM someone knocked on our door and let themselves in (assuming room service, though we had our do not disturb sign out). We let them know we were here and they left. The back of the door at the hotel says check out is at 12, however when you book they say 11.. either way, someone was letting themselves in before 11. We called the front desk and they told us check out is 11, and we explained it says 12 on the door so we will do our best to be out by 11. They were very kind about this, and extended our check out to 12, though it did leave a bit of a sour taste in my mouth. 


Overall our experience and stay was wonderful, however for what you pay for a room and for a 4 star hotel, I think a few things could‚Äôve been better. 

That said- the espresso martini by Josh (I believe, the gentleman working the night is 2/14), 10000/10!!

They did not give the room I booked and only gave one bed when we requested two. They stated that they don‚Äôt honor bookings through Expedia and it is essentially first come first serve. We then asked for an extra roll-away bed but they said they had given them out already and there were no more left. Terrible experience.

Excelentes instalaciones y el mejor servicio en recepci√≥n, sin embargo varias de las habitaciones ten√≠an un olor muy desagradable a ca√±er√≠a. Ten√≠amos 5 habitaciones en mi grupo, y 3 de ellas ol√≠an muy mal.
Adem√°s, tampoco hay caja de seguridad en las habitaciones, y algunos objetos desaparecieron (al reportarlo nos dijeron que supuestamente house-keeping no hab√≠a encontrado nada). Cuidado con eso, ya que nosotros nos arrepentimos de permitir que limpiaran la habitaci√≥n sin tener una caja de seguridad.
Very happy with our stay. Spacious and comfortable room and bathroom. Staff is super friendly. Great locatio, beautiful lobby. Would stay here again.
Beautiful property

The lobby was gorgeous and comfortable!
There was a bad smell on 6th floor for a day or so during my stay...like ?sewer.  I didn't tell the front desk but could have done so.
Convenient location and friendly staff. Always our go to when we attend professional sports events in Denver.

Excellent service at check in and check out by the same employee at the counter. Allowed my son and I an early check in on a very cold day so we could add a layer of clothes and be on our way to an early hockey game. Totally nice about it and fully accomodating. Nice large rooms, well maintained, quiet. Didn't go to the bar this visit, but I have on previous visits and its great and bartenders are good and personable. Great stay in Denver!
Male staff were nice
Service was outstanding, valet, check.in, bar, all hit a homerun.  Great stay.
Andrew at the front dest was amazingly professional. Thank you, Andrew!
It was a great hotel!

We had prepaid for a one bedroom suite and they did not honor the reservation because we booked through a third-party. Expedia/Hotels.com. I ended up with a standard king which was much less in price than what I prepaid and they refused to refund me saying we have to take it up with Hotels.com. I want a refund. Please contact me.
Beautiful property! We will definitely be back.

The Renaissance was clean, comfortable and the staff was courteous and professional. Check in was super efficient. This hotel is in a great location to see all the downtown spots‚Äîrestaurants and shopping. Breakfast would have been better if the food was hot, but it was free!
I loved my new year‚Äôs eve stay :)

Was amazing despite a pipe leakage which caused us to be moved out of our suite, the staff was more than accommodating. So sweet and made me feel more than welcome, definitely staying here from now on with upcoming vacations.
Rooms are in need of deep cleaning and updating.

The rooms were big, updated, clean, and provided everything we needed. The hotel ambiance was relaxing, staff were so welcoming and kind each and every day. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area.

The Renaissance Hotel was a sight to see I ended up meeting the love of my life, everything was exactly like my dream. It was a dream come true I'm shedding tears writing this because it's bringing me flashbacks of the fragments of time that will forever be cherished in my heart for the rest of my existence.

We had a great stay at the Renaissance. The property is located right in the heart of Denver city. Easy walking distance to 16th St mall, Union Station and Civic Centre. Room was beautiful, hotel lobby beautiful and staff so incredibly polite. They threw in a free breakfast for us for the holidays, and when we had a minor hiccough with a request we made, the staff went out of their way to make up for it.
Loved the stay! It‚Äôs was very nice
Honestly had a lovely stay here. The place was clean and I felt very welcomed when I first arrived. Beds were super comfy. I would definitely stay there again
More than I expected
Valet and front desk were amazing and gave us lots of recommendations for our time in Denver. The lobby was also very pretty and our room was clean and tidy.
Met most of our needs. Although the room we stayed in wall very thin and could hear water running through pipes.

It was great! Comfy bed shower was great had fantastic water pressure the bathroom was a little small but we made it work. Very quiet hotel. Close to lots of restaurants. Walking distance from Union Station
I loved the atmosphere of this hotel. Every area was spotless, The staff were friendly and accommodating. So many restaurants and bars within walking distance.
Muy buenos
Great place!

Beautiful hotel that was once the Colorado National Bank. We had a great city view from our room, and food from The Range restaurant in the lobby was great. Room service was fast and easy. Would definitely stay here again.
Excellent location. Unique and spectacular hotel with history as a bank that has been incorporated into the current set up.
No ten√≠a agua en la ducha
We really enjoyed our stay. The room was beautiful and the 3rd floor was very quiet. We will definitely book here again!
Great staff and clean hotel but room view was awful
Extremely nice hotel close to restaurants and entertainment. Very comfortable and clean.
The bank architecture is beautiful
Staff was extremely helpful and friendly.

Beautiful building, comfortable bed, clean room, nice shower. Great staff, especially Hass who helped us check in, get the lay of the land and settle in for the weekend. He made the difference between a solid good experience and a great experience. It was great. Thank you.
Nice property.

Highly recommend staying at the Renaissance Downtown Denver City Center Hotel. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is in walking distance to a lot of shops and restaurants.
Great
Muy buen lugar
A
Nice.   We were surprised by the good quality free breakfast.    Not the typical continental breakfast.  And plenty of little freebies that were available 24/7.   Made a difference.
The staff was great.
Wonderful hotel in a great area of downtown.  Everything was walkable.  The staff was awesome.  Thank you.

Excellent old building that used to be a bank. The old vaults and other features are still there Rooms are modern, great AC, and super quiet. Security features like keys to go up elevators, nighttime car attendants, and guest only entry after 11 are also a plus. Bar in the lobby is a great place for a drink or to stay awhile plus they have a good restaurant on site as well. Good proximity to Union Station, Denver Mint, Coors Field and great food and breweries.

The front desk staff were friendly and knowledgable. The property was clean, well-maintained, and the rooms were spacious. The housekeeping team refreshed the room every day. Overall a very nice hotel.

16 street, Main Street closed. No shops no restaurants. Hotel rooms/beds good, but  bathroom's dirty and very outdated. Bartenders unfriendly at the hotel 
Valet and front desk staff nice and welcoming
Great spot for our two day stay! Good food around, walkable to coors field and union station
Exceeded expectations and the breakfast was phenomenal
Great service and great breakfast
ÂæàÊ£íÁöÑ‰ΩèÂÆøÈ´îÈ©ó
Very nice hotel for the price.  Very convenient downtown location
The valet fellas were awesome! Everything was great except parking. Thumbs down for parking garage. The
What a lovely experience. The staff was amazing - I wanted to hang with them all day jajaj.
I wish we stayed more than one night
Very nice staff was very friendly. They had lockers for our stuff if we had a later flight.

It was only a one night stay, the room was alright, not as clean as I would have hoped for the quality. Staff was alright during check in, bar staff was..there, seemed minority inconvenienced when I approached. Check out was probably the highlight unfortunately. Overall I wasn‚Äôt really wowed by the stay.
It was nice and clean
Great property.  Right in the downtown area
Everything but the room was a hit!
Beautiful lobby, Great staff , And fast room service.

Please have more pillow selections and of better quality. Make sure the carpets in the hallways are properly cleaned cause they have a bad stench to some parts of them. Great lobby. Good food options on site.
Great hotel for a downtown Denver experience!!
Excelente ubicaci√≥n y un hotel muy bonito (era un antiguo banco)
Excellent little gem in heart of downtown Denver. My son lives nearby and it is my new go to.
This place is awesome downtown Denver ! We stayed during a slow week and the price was such a deal

Beautiful hotel with some great references to when the building was a bank. Nice bar and small restaurant. Great service and easy walking or scooter distance from Union Station and other spots. Of the four USB power outlets in the room, the two near the desk did not work. One of the plugs at the desk was loose and would not work. Some specs on the ceiling around some fire sensor or something. Overall clean but if you are putting USB ports at a desk, maybe check them and keep them working?
Worked out good for me . Recommending

Beautiful, unique hotel in great location with friendly, helpful staff.  Loved the decor immediately when we walked in.  This hotel is a renovated bank building creating a cool lobby.  The checkin was quick and seamless and we even got an early check in!  The room was clean and comfortable.  The air temperature was adjustable  to our needs (my son likes it cool to sleep).  The staff were friendly at each interaction particularly the coffee shop server, he was awesome every day.  Great location near multiple restaurants and downtown shops.  Close to the Denver Union Station also.  Parking is bit of a challenge but the 16th Street Center garage next door was easy to use.
Former bank now a hotel!!! Awesome!
Great hotel inside and out. Very friendly staff, Rooms in great condition and cleaned well. Close walking distance to many shops and restaurants as well.

This was our first time staying at this hotel and we were amazed by the hospitality.
They very conveniently located about half a mile from Denver union station and in the heart of denver downtown, which made our stay and roaming easier by walk and didn‚Äôt had to spend a fortune on rental cars or cab services.
Staff is amazing and quick to respond to all our queries and needs.
Our breakfast was complimentary with our stay, but the breakfast options were amazing and tasty.

We enjoyed our stay a lot
Our stay at the hotel was great. Very clean, quiet and comfortable!!
We thought the art and history of the building was great. Very cool place to get a drink. Easy to walk to places to eat/ drink.
I loved everything about this hotel. Close to everything, very quiet, friendly staff, safe area, I will stay here 1,000 more times!
In Denver for 1 night, it was a great place to stay. Lobby area was very inviting and comfortable for enjoying a drink after dinner, without having to be in a loud, crowded bar.
Beautiful hotel and nice staff.
The hotwl is beautiful and right downtown. Check in was smooth. Room was nice too.
Excelente, disfrutamos much√≠simo, muy recomendable
Great location, friendly staff
Lobby is amazing. Staff was friendly. Rooms were nice but probably due for a light remodel soon, cracked tile, torn carpets, scuffed paint, etc. Not bad but a little worn.

The hotel is in a good location downtown. The rooms are clean and adequate, although I had to move rooms because the first room had a vent that had the smell off kitchen cooking coming in from it. The staff were excellent and moved my room without fuss.
It was nice great location
Andrew was very accommodating. Would stay here again!
The room was great and there were plenty of shared spaces to find a spot to read and work.

My friend and I had a wonderful stay at this property, it‚Äôs perfectly located near many restaurants, shopping at the 16th street mall and public transportation. The staff was amazing, very kind, welcoming and accommodating.
Extraordinario
Awful experience, would not recommend.

The RENAISSANCE DENVER DOWNTOWN CITY CENTER HOTEL is a captivating blend of history and luxury. Housed in the former Colorado National Bank headquarters, revisiting it was a nostalgic journey for us, having worked here during its banking days. The staff's excellence, delectable food, and impeccable atmosphere make for an extraordinary experience. Amidst the downtown hustle, the hotel offers a peaceful haven, ensuring a restful sleep. A remarkable fusion of past and present, this hotel truly stands out.
Great stay snowed for 2 days
Excellent.
Overall good hotel and good location.
Beautiful hotel!

This Hotel was amazing great staff, great Hotel and the history of it being a bank was so cool. Valet parking and the Hotel is centered downtown within walking distance of everything Larimer st 16st mall the union station capital building the hotel is in a perfect area. The cafe and restaurant was great also and the bar was really nice.
Great stay@
The property was once one of the oldest banks in Denver, CO. So if you go to the lower floor you can find old bank vaults that have been renovated.
Overall very nice stay. A unique hotel in a former downtown bank.

The staff was so friendly and very very helpful. 
The front desk just did everything to make our stay comfortable and we went above and beyond. Tyler was great. 
Even the valet was so good. When I was airing for my wife to come out he came and gave me a couple of water bottles, just to make us happy. 
Amazing staff. 

Hotel interior was just WOW !!  Took so many pictures.

Very beautiful property, even more special for me as I used to work at Colorado National Bank back in the 80's.  One of the classiest banks ever and they have saved the best parts of the decor.  Highly recommend to anyone who wants a special experience besides a typical hotel stay!

The Renaissance was perfectly located for all of the activities we needed to accomplish. Having our child seen at the Jewish Health Center we needed easy parking, convenient food options and the hotel staff were incredibly accommodating. Would absolutely stay here again.
Room had outlets that didn‚Äôt work, lightbulbs that didn‚Äôt work, and bathroom sink did not drain well.

Our stay was great. The only thing we were disappointed with was that we had to pay for parking. The hotel would have been fairly priced if it included parking and not just valet. Overall we were satisfied
The whether was good and the stay was to
Great property to stay at.
No self parking
It was a nice hotel, the lobby was very pretty, gave a great first impression.  We enjoyed one evening sitting next to the fireplace before bed. All the staff was very friendly.
Loved the hotel!  Love the ambiance, the lobby, the location.  Staff was friendly, helpful, kind.
Great place, girl at the check-in counter was super accommodating as we arrived early. The room was gorgeous, the location was great, we will definitely stay again if we return to Denver.

The rooms were super clean and comfortable. The neighborhood is very walkable and full of things to do and places to eat.  We walked to and from a game at Coors Field, and it was a pleasant route.  

The restaurant was amazing!(We ordered room service due to illness and it was awesome and on par price-wise with nearby restaurants. I had the bacon burger and wife had the leadville salad, and we also ordered some brocollini--highly recommend).  

The only downside was that the door did little to keep out noise from the hallway, and someone knocked loudly on our door at 3:30 in the morning and then disappeared, but I can't fault the hotel for that.  There was almost no noise from the street or adjoining rooms. The architecture of the building and the neighborhood were truly magnificent.
The bed was very uncomfortable and the room was very small. The view faced a wall which didn‚Äôt allow much natural sunlight.
Staff went above and beyond to make me feel welcome. Comfortable room. Great breakfast.
Some construction down the street
Location
Great hotel
Everything
Would stay here again!
The staff members were amazing, the room was elegant, and the hotel is quiet. Definitely coming back.
Beautiful historic building, comfortable room, and helpful staff.  Worth the stay if you have business in downtown Denver.

The room service selection was very limited, I ordered twice and both times I received wrong items. The outside was very unsafe due to the amount of homeless people walking close by. Denver in general is not safe , the 16th street mall is comparable to skid row

The hotel was lovely and clean, excellent bed, very nice. The area the property is in had quite a lot of homeless people and some areas were a bit dirty. Walking distance to the Colorado Rockies baseball field.

Upon arrival we stood waiting in line to check in and when a staff member became available, instead of calling us over to help us, she turned and walked outside.  Once we were finally helped, we were told that the rooms we booked were not actually available as I'd been told on the phone. Then we had to wait 15 minutes because the rooms they were giving us weren't clean yet even though it was well after 4pm by this point. We were given free drink vouchers for during our wait, however the bartender walked away from the bar about this time and our rooms were actually ready before she came back. The rooms were very clean, which we greatly appreciated.  During breakfast the following morning we found ourselves waiting an inordinate amount of time for everything. Half the food came out, then a couple more plates, and by the time it was all out, half of it was cold. Several of the meals that were served had different ingredients than what was listed on the menu, and we were charged $40 for 2 carafes of sub par drip coffee. It took us a long time to get the checks when we were finished eating, and even longer to get our cards back.  Overall, we were incredibly disappointed in the customer service and wait times.  The cleanliness of the hotel and rooms was the single highlight of our stay.
Great downtown Denver Hotel, middle of the city, good amenities on-site

El edificio es espectacular, muy buenas instalaciones. super novedoso. No hay tanto por hacer a la rendonda, pero el restaurante del hotel y Panzano que se encuentra enfrente son una maravilla.

Muy recomendable

Beautiful converted bank building complete with the old vaults, beautiful lobby.  Excellent, friendly staff.  Prompt check-in and check-out service.  Excellent room cleaning.  Room was nice but not especially large.  Excellent, quiet HVAC.
Hotel was awesome. Very warm and inviting.
Buena opci√≥n en el centro de Denver.
Beautiful interior, comfy room, delicious food and drinks available. Had a wonderful stay for my anniversary.
We had a nice stay
